page.title: 01Dronehill and Colldingham
page.content: Coldingham Moor is the wetlands area of Berwickshire, lying 3 iels to the north west of Coldingha village. This common Moor is very exposed to the weather, at a height of 600ft.The greatest part of the moor is in its natural state with wed soils,which are cold bluish clay and very rocky. This and barren moor has several types of peatmosses, and grasses on the wetter pars. The land was once used for collecting peat, but is now used for grazing. Despite the ares ideal location on the coast for tourist development, this is lost through it relative unattractiveness although there is a caravansite. A predominant feature of this area is the abundance of redundant farm buildings which scar the landscape on land which was at one timme fertile, is now useless for farming.
